description: Smallest number m such that m(m+1)/2 is divisible by n.
comments: Also called pseudo-Smarandache numbers.a(2^k) = 2^(k+1)-1; a(m)=m-1 and for odd prime powers m. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 26 2003
references: C. Ashbacher, The Pseudo-Smarandache Function and the Classical Functions of Number Theory, Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 9, No. 1-2, 1998, 79-82.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
K. Kashihara, Comments and Topics on Smarandache Notions and Problems.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pseudosmarandache Function
formula: a(n) <= 2n-1 for all numbers n; a(n) <= n-1 for odd n. - _Stefan Steinerberger_, Apr 03 2006
